Message.Title: taxes killed the USA in the 1950s, killed the jobs, and all the "job creators" left whine about high taxes
Message.Msg: "On income roughly between $32,000 and $64,000, in today’s dollars, couples in the 1950s faced a 22 percent tax rate. On income that today would equal between $500,000 and $600,000, affluent Americans faced a tax rate of 65 percent. The highest 1950s tax rate, 91 percent, fell on annual income that would today exceed $3.2 million. Today, our federal tax rates rise much less steeply. The current top rate? The “fiscal-cliff battle” earlier this winter raised the top federal rate on individual income over $400,000 from 35 to 39.6 percent, less than half the 91 percent top rate in effect through the Eisenhower years."

Topic.Title: taxes killed the USA in the 1950s, killed the jobs, and all the "job creators" left whine about high taxes

Message.Msg: Factoid: after the recent tax act, top quintile tax rates are now 5 times higher than the second quintile, up from 2x in 1979 as progressivity increases further. The issue is that the people on the bottom quintile pay NEGATIVE taxes, and the bottom 49% pay nothing or get a credit. Thus, it all falls on the top. Further, when the marginal rates were 70%, the effective rate for the top 1% was 21.8%, but now with the top marginal rate at only 35% theeffective tax rate for that same group is 19.4. All in all, I seriously doubt you paid a higher effective rate in the 80s, dude.

Topic.Title: Paul Ryan advisor says for Cutting Social Security, 'Wealthy' Begins at $25K

Message.Msg: Of course, if you would spend a little time reading the data you will find several things: First, raising the minimum wage does, in fact, slow employment. Second, it is especially brutal on the age group of teens through 22. Third, a very small portion of wage earners actually stay in the minimum wage range (the point is to grow into other jobs), so raising the minimum wage under the guise families need it is a canard. the simplest fact is that scores of union contracts across the country are based on the prevailing minimum wage. So, increasing the minimum wage automatically increases union wages.

Topic.Title: Paul Ryan advisor says for Cutting Social Security, 'Wealthy' Begins at $25K

Message.Msg: you obviously don't read the data, in fact you are just a liar. 1. min wage has nothing to do with union wages. 2. 9/10ths of min wage workers are 20 yrs or older 3. more than half work full time 4. more than a 1/3 are married 5. there is NO data to show an increase of UE when the min wage is raised 6. you righties are hypocrites because you whine about the min wage.... and then you whine when the people on it can't feed their families and have to go on food stamps 7. it is insane to think that low wages are good for an economy... that is why henry ford doubled the wage so that his workers could afford to buy the cars they were building ... and ditto , of course for the rest of the economy 8. everyone knows that high wage, strong union Germany is the trade surplus leader of the world.

Topic.Title: Der Fuhrer Obama now charging protection money!

Message.Msg: ABC is defending its decision to edit out an apparently erroneous claim by Michelle Obama in its broadcast of the first lady’s interview on Good Morning America today, saying it made the changes “solely” for the sake of time. As The Washington Examiner reported this morning, the first lady claimed during an interview with Good Morning America’s Robin Roberts that 15-year-old Hadiya Pendleton, who was killed in Chicago shortly after performing during the President’s Inauguration, was shot because “some kids had some automatic weapons they didn’t need.” In fact, Chicago Police reported Pendleton was shot by a man who “opened fire with a handgun before fleeing in a waiting car,” according to the Associated Press.
